original: Carle, Gunnar, överstelöjtnant, Karlskrona, f. 21/5/99 i Kalmar av landsfiskal Carl E. Fransen o. Ellen Ahlstedt. G. 24 m. Maud Lindblom. Barn: Ulla f. 27, Rolf 30, Björn 40. — Stud:ex. v. Lunds priv. elem:sk. 18, off:ex. 20, gymn:lär:ex. 26, KSHS 28. Vollehrgang für Leibesübungen v. tyska marinen 30, stud :resa t. anst. f. fysisk fostran i Tyskl. 30. Löjtn. 23, kapt. 35, major 42, öv:löjtn. 45. Ka-dettoff. v. KSHS 36, lär. i gymn. o. vapenföring v. KSHS 36-40, chef f. försv. gymn:- o. idr:sk. 37-43, chef f. kustart. und:off:sk. 43-46, bat:chef v. KA. 2 sed. 43. Fd. led. av styr. f. Sv. fäktförb., Sv:esi mil. idr:förb. o. För-•en. f. fäktkonsit. främj. RSO, Sv:es mil. idr:förb. förtj :GM, Sv. fäktförb. förtj :GM, Fören. f. fäktkonstens främj. förtj: GM samt div. idr:- o. ^skyttemärken.
translated: Carle, Gunnar, Lieutenant Colonel, Karlskrona, b. May 21st, 1899 in Kalmar to district judge Carl E. Fransen and Ellen Ahlstedt. Married in 1924 to Maud Lindblom. Children: Ulla b. 1927, Rolf b. 1930, Björn b. 1940. He passed his matriculation exam at Lund's private elementary school in 1918, officer's exam in 1920, physical education teacher's exam in 1926, and Royal Swedish Army Physical Training college exam in 1928. Voluntary training for physical education in the German navy in 1930. Studied physical education in Germany in 1930. Lieutenant in 1923, Captain in 1935, Major in 1942, Lieutenant Colonel in 1945. Cadet officer at Royal Swedish Army Physical Training college in 1936, teacher in gymnastics and weapon handling at the same school from 1936-1940, chief of defense gymnasium and sports school from 1937-1943, chief of coastal artillery non-commissioned officers' school from 1943-1946, and battalion commander of the Second Artillery Regiment since 1943. Former member of the board for the Swedish fencing association, Swedish military sports association, and Association for the promotion of Fencing committee. He received the Royal Order of the Sword, Swedish military sports association merits medal of gold, Swedish fencing association merits medal of gold, and Association for the promotion of Fencing committee merits medal of gold, as well as various sports and shooting honors and medals.
